titleStmt.title: Inscription in honour of the deceased praet. prefect Praetextatus, from Rome (Pal. Altemps)

availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

msIdentifier.repository: Rome, Museo Nazionale Romano, Palazzo Altemps, ground floor, portico of the courtyard next to the theatre entrance

summary.term: Honorary inscription for the praetorian prefect Praetextatus

layout.p: Two inscribed fields (frons: cymatium and two columns; latus dex.).

history.provenance: Rome, seen for the first time in the gardens of the Villa dei Mattei on the Caelian Hill

div.ab:
in a line above the two columns of writing
Vettio Agorio Praetextato, viro clarissimo

pontifici Vestae,
pontifici Solis,
quindecemviro,
auguri,
tauroboliato,
curiali,
neocoro,
hierofantae,
patri sacrorum.

quaestori
candidato,
praetori urbano,
correctori Tus
ciae et Umbriae,
consulari
Lusitaniae,
proconsuli
Achaiae,
praefecto urbi,
praefecto praetorio II
Italiae et Illyrici,
consuli
designato.

Dedicata Kalendis Februariis
domino nostro Flavio Valentiniano Augusto III
et Eutropio conssulibus.

div.p: Edition based on CIL 06, 01778, EDR126995. Text was seen and verified by Porena 2018.

app.note: PRAEE, Gordon 1965, Gordon 1983, LSA; praefecto, Duthoy 1969; praef(ecto), EDR, Dubosson-Sbriglione 2018
EI, Gordon 1965, Gordon 1983; YLLYRICI, Gordon 1965, Gordon 1983

div.p: To Vettius Agorius Praetextatus, of clarissimus rank, pontifex of Vesta, pontifex of the Sun, quindecemvir, augur, tauroboliate, curialis, neocorus, hierophant, father of the sacred rites; candidate quaestor, urban praetor, corrector of Tuscia and Umbria, consularis of Lusitania, proconsul of Achaia, prefect of the City, praetorian prefect twice* of Italy and Illyricum, designated consul.
Dedicated on the Kalends of February, during the consulship of our master Flavius Valentinianus Augustus for the third time and of Eutropius”.

Au clarissime Vettius Agorius Praetextatus, pontife de Vesta, pontife du Soleil, quindécemvir, augure, taurobolié, curiale, néocore, hiérophante, père des cérémonies sacrées; questeur candidat, préteur urbain, correcteur de Tuscie et d’Ombrie, consulaire de Lusitanie, proconsul d’Achaïe, préfet de la Ville, préfet du prétoire deux fois* d’Italie et d’Illyricum, consul désigné.
(Statue) dédiée le jour des calendes de février, sous le consulat de notre seigneur Flavius Valentinien Auguste, pour la troisième fois, et d’Eutropius”.

p.note: other French transl.: Chastagnol 1991 (2nd ed.), pp. 157-158, nr. 41C; Bricault 2005, pp. 552-553, nr. 501/0181; Dubosson-Sbriglione 2018, pp. 504-505, nr. 107

div.p: Al chiarissimo Vettius Agorius Praetextatus, pontefice di Vesta, pontefice del Sole, quindecemviro, augure, tauroboliato, curiale, neocoro, ierofante, padre dei sacri riti; questore candidato, pretore urbano, correttore di Tuscia ed Umbria, consolare della Lusitania, proconsole d’Acaia, prefetto urbano, prefetto del pretorio ‘doppio’* dell’Italia e dell’Illirico, console designato.
Dedicata alle Calende di febbraio durante il consolato del nostro signore Flavius Valentinianus Augustus per la terza volta e di Eutropius”.
* “praetorian prefect at the same time over two seats”, concerning the iteration see Commentary.
The critical edition, translations and commentary of inscriptions 77-80 will be completed by the end of April 2022. We apologise for the delay.

div.p: praef(ecto) praet(orio) II Italiae et Illyrici
